gurmukhi: cwNp cFwie mhwN irs KwiekY loihq bwn su KYNc clwXo ] sRI grVwsin jwnkY sXwm mno duhby khu q`Ck DwXo ]1830]
transliteration: Chaanp Chadhaae Mahaan Ris Khaae-kai Lohit Baan Su Khainch Chalaayo|| Srigadadaasan(i) Jaan-kai Syaam Mano Duhbe Kauh Tachchhak Dhaayo||1830||
translation: Pulling his bow he discharged such an arrow as if the serpent Takshak was coming to bind down Garuda.1830.

gurmukhi: Awvq qw sr ko liK kY biRjnwiek Awpny SsqR sMBwry ] kwn pRmwn lau KYNc kmwn clwie dey ijn ky prkwry ]
transliteration: Oovat Taa Sar Ko Lakh(i) Kai Brijnaaik Aapane Shastra Sanbhdare|| Kaan Pramaan Lau Khainch Kamaan Chadhaae Dae Jin Ke Parkdare||
translation: Seeing that arrow coming, Krishna held his weapons, and pulling his bow upto his ear, discharged the arrows;

gurmukhi: BUp sMBwr kY Fwl iqh m`D lgY nih jwq inkwry ] mwnhu sUrj ky gRsby khu rwh ky bwhn pMK pswry ]1831]
transliteration: Bhoop Sanbhaar Kai Dhaal Laitih Maddh Lagad Nah(i) Jaat Nikdare|| Maanoh Sooraj Ke Grasbe Kauh Raah Ke Baahn Pankh Pasdare||1831||
translation: The king held his shield; the arrows struck it, which could not be pulled out inspite of the effort, it seemed as if the vehicle of advancing Rahu had spread its wings in order to swallow the sun.1831.

gurmukhi: BUpq pwn kmwn leI biRjnwiek kau liK bwn clwey ] ieau Cutky kr ky br qy aupmw iqnkI kib sXwm sunwey ]
transliteration: Bhoopat Paan Kamaan Laibrijnaaik Kau Lakh(i) Baan Chadhaae|| Io Chhoutake Kar Ke Bar Te Oupmaa Tin-kikabi Syaam Sounaae||
translation: The king took his bow and arrows in his hands and making Krishna as his target, he discharged his arrows;

gurmukhi: myG kI bUMdn ijau brKy sr sRI biRjnwQ ky aUpr Awey ] mwnhu sUrn hI sr so iqh B`Cn ko slBw imil Dwey ]1832]
transliteration: Megh Kiboondan Jio Barkhe Sar Sribrijnaath Ke Oopar Aae|| Maanoh Sooran Hisar So Tih Bhachchhan Ko Salbhaa Mil(i) Dhaae||1832||
translation: The arrows were shot by the king in such a way and were showered on Krishna like the drops of rain coming down from the clouds; it appeared that the arrows were running as moths in order to eat the fire of anger of the warriors.1832.

gurmukhi: jo sr BUp clwvq hY iqn ko biRjnwiek kwt auqwry ] Pokn qy Pl qy miD qy pl mY kr KMfn KMf kY fwry ]
transliteration: Jo Sar Bhoop Chadaavat Hai Tin Ko Brijnaaik Kaat Outdare|| Phokan Te Phal Te Madh(i) Te Pal Mai Kar Khanndan Khanndkai Ddare||||
translation: All the arrows discharged by the king had been intercepted by Krishna; and he has been chopping the blades and middle portions of the arrows into bits in an instant;

gurmukhi: AYsIX BwNiq pry iCq mY mno bIj ko eIK ikswn inkwry ] sXwm ky bwn iscwn smwn mno Air bwn ibhMg sMGwry ]1833]
transliteration: Aiseeya Bhaant(i) Dare Chhit Mai Mano Beej Ko Eekh Kisaan Nikdare|| Syaam Ke Baan Sichaan Smaan Mano Ar(i) Baan Bihan Sanhdare||1833||
translation: It looks like the portions of the sugarcane chopped by the farmer for sowing; the arrows of Krishna are like falcons who are destroying the enemies as birds.1833.

gurmukhi: eyk Er sRI hir lry jrwisMD ky sMg ] duqI Er bl hl ghy hnI sYn cqurMg ]1834]
transliteration: Ek Or Srihar(i) Dare Jaraasindh Ke San|| Doutior Bal Hal Gade Hanisain Chaturan||1834||
translation: On one side Krishna is fighting with Jarasandh and on the other side, the mighty Balram is destroying the army taking up his plough in his hand.1834.

gurmukhi: bl pwn ley su kiRpwn sMGwrq bwj krI rQ pYdl AwXo ] mwr hraul Bjwie dhy niRp gol ky m`iD prXo qb DwXo ]
transliteration: Bal Paan Lae Su Kridaan Sanhaarat Baaj Karirath Paidal Aayo|| Maar Haraul Bhajaae Dahe Nrip Gol Ke Madh(i) Daryo Tab Dhaayo||
translation: Balram taking his sword in his hand killed horses, elephants and soldiers on foot and shattered the chariots; he fell upon the group of kings and with his plough, caused all of them to run away;
